snippet: Joshua Samuel Aaron, who has been living in Moscow, was arrested at Kennedy Airport and was charged with stealing information about 100 million consumers....
abstract: Joshua Samuel Aaron, suspect in 2014 massive data breach at JP Morgan Chase, voluntarily gives himself up to authorities at Kennedy Airport; pleads not guilty to federal charges of conspiracy, computer hacking, securities fraud and other criminal activities; co-defendants Gery Shalon and Ziv Orenstein were arrested in July 2015 and extradited from Israel in June.
lead_paragraph: Joshua Samuel Aaron, who has been living in Moscow, was arrested at Kennedy Airport and was charged with stealing information about 100 million consumers.

headline.main: U.S. Citizen Living Abroad Returns to Face Charges in Vast Data Breach
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Vast Data Breach Returns to Face U.S. Charges
